data.title: esc doesn't dismiss SelectList-based views
data.body: Instead, `Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'nodeType' of undefined`. To reproduce, Press `cmd-P` and then `esc`.

data.title: Atom doesn't remember full-screen state if it's started without a project context
data.body:
1. Open Atom without context, via Spotlight or Applications
2. Full-screen Atom
3. Quit
4. Open Atom the same way

I expect Atom to still be full-screen, but it's not.

/cc #1144

data.title: Simplify package package.json files
How can I have two consistent panes?
data.body:
I don't think this is a bug, but I'm not sure where to ask. I use my editor with two side-by-side panes. For me, **structure** of my editor (the fact that it's divided up into two panes, split vertically, or the fact that I've disabled the treeview and tabs) has _nothing to do_ with the **contents** of it (the open buffers). I manage them separately. When things are working smoothly I don't manage them at all.

Atom seems like it continues to tie the idea of splits, etc to the idea of buffers, and I don't understand why. I'm consistently frustrated by this, whether it's an inability to manage panes when there are no open buffers, an inability to unsplit panes, or the fact that a pane disappears when its last buffer is closed.

I feel like we've talked this over a ton of times, but things don't feel any different than they did nine months ago.

data.title: "Sign into GitHub" doesn't give any feedback
data.body:
I just started Atom on a brand new machine. Since there's no first-time experience at all, the thing that caught my eye was the light blue squirrel in the bottom right corner.

It didn't have a tooltip, so I clicked on it to see what it was. It opened a "Release Notes" panel, which told me I wasn't "logged in" and then asked me to "sign into" GitHub.

I clicked the button and a "Sign in to GitHub" pane showed up. After I entered my username and password the pane went away, but nothing else happened.

Maybe it's 2FA? I at least expect some feedback.

data.title: Keybinding for reloading is too hard to hit
data.body:
Reloading specs and an Atom development pane is a pretty common occurrence. The recently changed keybinding requires an amazing feat of dexterity to hit with one hand.

`Alt-R` seems to be a pretty good substitute. It currently does nothing in vanilla Atom and Sublime Text. My personal preference would be `meta-R`, which does nothing in Sublime, but opens up the symbol view in Atom.

data.title: Ship an Setup.exe
data.body:
This is the top-level PR for getting an automated installer into Atom. To avoid gigantic PRs the plan is to separate this into a few parts:
## TODO:
- [ ] `PostSetup.exe`, which will handle both decompressing the `resources` folder after Setup completes, as well as compressing `resources` during the build so we don't have to have two separate EXEs (Separate PR)
- [ ] Build script to operate on `atom-build` to create the release (Separate PR)
- [ ] Documentation for the build process and how setup / updates work (started in `docs/installer-notes-win32.md`)

data.title: Add license
data.body:
We should probably decide on a license before the private alpha starts.

This PR is an attempt at that with an initial choice of the MIT license.

Once we agree on one for atom/atom, I'll update all other package repos with the same license.

/cc @hoolio @defunkt

data.title: Search with no results turns the window red and flashes
data.body: Press cmd-f, enter a search string that won't be found, press Enter, and the window turns red and flashes. This started happening today after a `git pull && script/build`.

data.title: Strange exception related to markers and undo
data.body:
@mcolyer and I have both seen this stack trace intermittently. I may have narrowed it down to an invalid index getting assigned as the start or end of an array marker underlying a string marker. Previously, we were just returning `undefined` from `String::pointForIndex` when the index was out of range. I'm going to throw an exception instead in the newest Telepath and see if we can get closer.

![screen shot 2013-11-22 at 3 40 46 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1789/1604433/04d8340c-53be-11e3-9fd4-7a929745be28.png)

data.title: Remove global functions
data.body:
This removes the last remaining `window` global functions.

After this PR all that will be left on `window` (besides the `atom` global) will be:
- `measure(description, fn)`
- `profile(description, fn)`

These could go on the `Atom` class as well but they seem to make sense to have on `window` since they are only for debugging.

data.title: Splitting in terminal fails
data.body:
If I press `cmd+k down`, I receive this (as of da713da3) but only when I've got a terminal tab open. The pane splitting works as expected with an editor.

```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getState' of undefined on /Users/mcolyer/github/atom/src/pane.coffee:80
```

data.title: ~/.atom/user.js
data.body: We support config.cson and config.json, user.css and user.less, so we should also support a user.js as well as user.coffee.

data.title: :fire: window.resourcePath
data.body: Forgot to remove this in the previously clean up PRs.

data.title: Pass originalEvent property on command events
data.body:
vim-mode needs access to the original keystroke that triggered the event.

@probablycorey is this cool with you? I need it for atom/vim-mode#42.

data.title: Check selectors using webkitMatchesSelector
data.body:
Previously the bindings to include used direct string comparison for inclusion.

This excluded things that were now using `body.platform-darwin editor:not(.mini)` since it wasn't an exact match such as move line up/down.

![screen shot 2013-11-21 at 2 21 59 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/671378/1596419/75e1e878-52fb-11e3-90c4-9e08a3f0bfd6.png)

Now the selector is directly tested against an `.editor` element or the actual `document.body` so the string comparisons aren't needed.

/cc @mcolyer Would love your thoughts on this.

data.title: Store build modules in build/node_modules
data.body:
- grunt tasks and the `Gruntfile.coffee` are now in build
- modules used by the build are stored in `build/node_modules`
- `grunt` command no longer works from the root of the repository since it isn't in the root `node_modules` anymore.
  - You can do: `script/build lint` to just run a single grunt task.

Closes #1067

data.title: Blank menu bar when Atom is started in full-screen
data.body:
I had Atom full-screened, and I quit. When I started Atom again via `atom` it went back to full screen, but there was a weird bar on the top of the screen:

![screen shot 2013-11-20 at 20 02 53](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3117/1589048/0540ce34-5262-11e3-8a01-32fe6ce85c8d.png)

Disabling and reënabling full-screen made it go away.

/cc @ymendel

data.title: Disabling the tabs package messes up tab styles
data.body: I'm messing with some config changes and I re-added `tree-view` and `tabs` to `core.disabledPackages`. When I added `tree-view` and saved the tree view immediately disappeared. When I did the same thing with `tabs` the tab UI got all fugly immediately, but it didn't disappear until I did a full reset.

data.title: Proposal: add a way for packages to communicate with one another
data.body:
I added an API to the status-bar. Other packages that want to use the status bar have a bit of an awkward time getting a handle on the `statusBar` object. For reference see: https://github.com/atom/grammar-selector/pull/2 Here's how it works now:

In the status bar, I do this:

``` coffeescript
statusBar = new StatusBarView()
atom.rootView.statusBar = statusBar
```

And in the package using status-bar:

``` coffeescript
# This is dumb:
createStatusEntry = ->
  view = new GrammarStatusView(atom.rootView.statusBar)
  atom.rootView.statusBar.appendLeft(view)

if atom.rootView.statusBar
  createStatusEntry()
else
  atom.packages.once 'activated', ->
    createStatusEntry()
```

I dont want to have every package author that wants to use something to the status bar to have to do this.
### Proposal

I want to have some mechanism in one of the readily available objects (`atom`, `rootView`) for storage/retrieval of arbitrary objects. This is generally what I want to do:

In status-bar

``` coffeescript
statusBar = new StatusBarView()
atom.rootView.setChild('statusBar', statusBar)
```

In the package that uses status-bar

``` coffeescript
atom.rootView.getChild 'statusBar', (statusBar) ->
  view = new GrammarStatusView(atom.rootView.statusBar)
  atom.rootView.statusBar.appendLeft(view)
```

If `statusBar` is already there, it calls the callback, or it waits til `statusBar` is available.

I have no idea what to call these functions, and have no preference which object it should hang from.

Feedback, please.

data.title: Use `.workspace` rather than `body` for keybindings
data.body: Integrating this change will require users to update their keymaps to reference `.workspace` where they previously referenced `body`. That way our new platform specific key bindings won't override user configured bindings.

data.title: Upgrade to telepath with reference semantics
data.body:
The telepath changes are discussed here: https://github.com/atom/telepath/pull/4

This is going to make working with the document a lot easier, because you'll be able to have cyclic references. This is all getting really close to fruition.

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1789/1578450/00ac5bfe-517c-11e3-88a6-bee69f51d062.png)
